revised_title: Trypanosome Infection and Sexual Selection in Pied Flycatchers
tldr: The study found that female pied flycatchers with a male secondary sexual trait had lower levels of blood trypanosome infection. This suggests that the male trait may signal parasite resistance, and females choose males with these traits for better chances of successful mating and passing on resistance genes to their offspring.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Ecology and Evolution
